newsitem.title: USA: FileNet plunges on dismal earnings forecast.
newsitem.headline: FileNet plunges on dismal earnings forecast.

text.p: Filenet Corp. stock tumbled Friday after the computer software company said fourth-quarter earnings would be lower than last year's quarter.
Filenet shares lost $8.50 to $23.25 in active trading on Nasdaq, where its loss of 25.6 percent was the second-biggest of the session.

The Costa Mesa, Calif.-based company said late Thursday that it expects fourth quarter earnings of 20 cents a share, down from 32 cents a share in the 1995 quarter. It said it expected sales of $73 million vs. $67.7 million.
Fourth quarter revenues and earnings were hurt by a number of customers delaying their orders or reducing the size of their orders late in the quarter, Filenet said.
"However, we did meet our objective of increasing our order backlog," Chief Executive Ted Smith said in a statement issued after the close of regular trading.
For the 1996 full year, Filenet sees revenues of about $269 million, compared with $229 million last year.

Net income, before one-time after-tax charges for merger, restructuring and write-off of purchased in-process research and development costs, will be about 82 cents a share compared with 83 cents a share in 1995.
Filenet specialises in document-imaging, electronic document management and output on laser disks for corporate networks. It will release results on Feb. 6.
